trails.name: Appalachian Trail
trails.description: The Appalachian Trail is a long hiking trail extending from Georgia to Maine.
trails.details: Length: 2,200 miles. High point: 6,643 feet. Low point: 124 feet.

trails.name: Pacific Crest Trail
trails.description: A long-distance hiking trail closely aligned with the highest portion of the Sierra Nevada and Cascade mountain ranges.
trails.details: Length: 2,653 miles. High point: 13,153 feet. Low point: 140 feet.

trails.name: Continental Divide Trail
trails.description: A long hiking trail that follows the Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountains.
trails.details: Length: 3,100 miles. High point: 14,278 feet. Low point: 3,900 feet.

trails.name: John Muir Trail
trails.description: A long-distance trail in the Sierra Nevada mountain range of California.
trails.details: Length: 211 miles. High point: 14,505 feet. Low point: 4,000 feet.

trails.name: Inca Trail to Machu Picchu
trails.description: A hiking trail in Peru that terminates at Machu Picchu.
trails.details: Length: 26 miles. High point: 13,828 feet. Low point: 7,972 feet.

trails.name: Mount Kilimanjaro
trails.description: Several routes lead to the summit of the highest mountain in Africa.
trails.details: Length varies depending on route. High point: 19,341 feet.

trails.name: Overland Track
trails.description: One of Australia's most famous bush treks, situated in the Tasmania Wilderness World Heritage Area.

trails.name: Laugavegur Trail
trails.description: A multi-day trek in the highlands of Iceland, known for its geothermal landscapes.

trails.name: Tour du Mont Blanc
trails.description: A popular long-distance trek around Mont Blanc, passing through three different countries.

trails.name: Tongariro Northern Circuit
trails.description: One of the New Zealand's Great Walks, this trail circles the active volcanoes of Mt Tongariro and Mt Ngauruhoe.

trails.name: The Haute Route
trails.description: A high-level traverse in the French and Swiss Alps, from Chamonix to Zermatt.

trails.name: Everest Base Camp Trek
trails.description: A famous trek to the base camp of Mount Everest, the world's highest mountain.

trails.name: Te Araroa Trail
trails.description: A long distance trail running from the top of the North Island to the bottom of the South Island in New Zealand.

trails.name: Camino de Santiago
trails.description: A network of pilgrims' ways leading to the shrine of the apostle Saint James the Great in the cathedral of Santiago de Compostela in Galicia in northwestern Spain.
trails.details: Length: Varies. The most popular route (Camino Franc√©s) is 490 miles.

trails.name: Fitz Roy Trek
trails.description: A trek in Patagonia to the base of the stunning Fitz Roy mountain.
